DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to test whether optimal patient turning, strictly every 2 hours with at least 15 minutes of tissue decompression, reduces the occurrence of hospital acquired pressure ulcers.
DOC.brief_title: Optimal Patient Turning for Reducing Hospital Acquired Pressure Ulcers
DOC.detailed_description: This single site, open label, two arm randomized control trial aims to evaluate whether optimal patient turning, strictly every 2 hours with at least 15 minutes of tissue decompression, reduces the occurrence of hospital acquired pressure ulcers. Optimal turning procedures will be obtained with the use of a patient monitoring system (Leaf Healthcare, Inc.) and compared to standard preventative care practices.
DOC.criteria: Adults (>18 years of age) Admission to Intensive Care Unit Children (<18 years of age) Adhesive allergy Physical limitation for sensor application
